arts.ttl: 'It had everything': Reading boss on late Wycombe Wanderers win and season-high crowd
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt was left impressed with his side's second half performance in Saturday's 1-0 victory over near-neighbours Wycombe Wanderers. The Royals bounced ball from Tuesday's 3-0 defeat at Blackpool to edge past promotion-chasing Chairboys, Harvey Knibbs scoring a 75th-minute penalty. A clash lacking the usual quality, it was played in front of a passionate atmosphere as over 15,000 supporters turned out in glorious sunshine. Speaking after the win, Hunt said: "I don’t think we started the best, they came out of the traps quicker than us, but we weathered the storm for 25 minutes and after that we came into the game and come the end of it, we were the better team.

arts.ttl: 'It has been a really harsh week' - Mike Dodds reflects as Wycombe lose at Reading
arts.sum: Wycombe Wanderers head coach Mike Dodds said it has been a ‘harsh’ week for the club after they dropped more points in the promotion push.

arts.ttl: Harvey Knibbs penalty seals Reading victory in top of the table clash with Wycombeq
arts.sum: Harvey Knibbs' late penalty was enough for Reading to edge a feisty Berks-Bucks clash with promotion-chasing Wycombe Wanderers 1-0. More than 15,000 packed into the SCL Stadium for the highest crowd of the season and while the football on display was not the best of the season, the victory was vital after Tuesday's 3-0 defeat at Blackpool. Reading were boosted pre-match with the return of Amadou Mbengue and Tyler Bindon from injury and illness respectively. Wycombe certainly edged a fiery first-half, with Reading off the boil and failing to threaten Will Norris between the posts. It took two minutes for Joel Periera to be forced into a save as Knibbs’ misjudged back header fell to Adam Reach and his half-volley was flicked wide. From the resulting corner the ball was in the net, but the linesman’s flag cut short any celebrations from the 1,600 travelling supporters. Mbengue was needed on the 10-minute mark as Andre Garcia failed to spot the

arts.ttl: Wycombe Wanderers lose more ground on automatic promotion following Reading loss
arts.sum: Wycombe Wanderers’ push for promotion took another stumble as they lost 1-0 away to Thames Valley neighbours Reading.

arts.ttl: Wycombe’s automatic promotion hopes hit by defeat at Reading
Live updates: Reading look to return to winning ways with Wycombe visit
arts.sum: Reading look to bounce back from midweek defeat in Blackpool in the Berks-Bucks Derby with Wycombe Wanderers. The Royals were 11 unbeaten before Tuesday but sit seventh. The Chairboys are third, hunting automatic promotion.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Favoured central defence returns for Wycombe Wanderers visit
arts.sum: Reading favourites Tyler Bindon and Amadou Mbengue return to the starting line-up this lunchtime for the highly-anticipated Berks-Bucks clash with Wycombe Wanderers. Both have missed recent matches through illness and injury respectively, but both were keen to return and help the Royals battle for the play-offs. Their 11-match unbeaten run came to an abrupt end on Tuesday, losing 3-0 to Blackpool, while Wycombe sit third ahead of this clash set to be played in front of a bumper crowd.

arts.ttl: Reading legend on 'horrendous' off-field crisis and 'remarkable' on-field success
arts.sum: Former Reading legend Steve Sidwell has labelled the work Noel Hunt has done 'remarkable' as they continue to hunt down the play-offs. Sidwell made nearly 200 appearances in four-and-a-half years with the club, winning two promotions before joining Chelsea and enjoying a Premier League career with the likes of Fulham and Stoke City. Now a prominent pundit, the former midfielder was on Sky Sports and discussed the ongoing off-field crisis at the club, labelling it 'horrendous' and 'never-ending.' However, in spite of this Hunt and his Royals sit just a point outside the play-offs with seven matches remaining. "Off the field, it’s nothing short of horrendous, said Sidwell. "Dai Yongge went in there- probably seeing a quick way to the Premier League- and threw a lot of money in at the start. He went about it in the wrong manner with ridiculous wages and then it snowballed. Off the pitch it’s very complex with a lot of parties involved and legal action. I think there’s not a lot of noise because people don’t know what to say in case they get in trouble.

arts.ttl: Preview: Reading vs. Wycombe Wanderers - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's League One clash between Reading and Wycombe Wanderers, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.

arts.ttl: Reading owner Yongge given extension to sell club
arts.sum: Reading owner Dai Yongge is given an extension to his deadline where he must divest his interests in the club.
